detailsOfAchievement: AROHA is an NGO founded with a vision to help rural, tribal and under privileged urban women, in their endeavour of sustainable livelihood. Founder members Vishakha Rao-Jathar and Sharmistha Gandhi are experts in conceptualising and execution of comprehensive livelihood programmes AROHAs Initiatives in Vidarbha AROHA believes that with the economic independence, women start gaining self confidence, attain respect in the family and society and start participating in the decision making process. Till date around 14000 women from Vidharbha have participated in the capacity building programmes conducted by AROHA. Activities and the the Impact Economic and Social Empowerment of Women. AROHA has mobilised 3000 rural poor women to participate in the Self Help Groups. An intervention of AROHA has developed their capacity to become self reliant for their social and economic development. Cluster Development of microenterprises of Women ARANYAK hand pounded rice cluster at dist. Gadchiroli. Here 50 tribal women were motivated to make and sale the handpounded rice. Role of AROHA was to standardise the product, train these women in quality control, branding and packaging of the product as Arranyak rice and link them to the Market. WARDHINI Multiproduct cluster at Wardha district District Rural Development Agency, Wardha invited AROHA to work with the rural BPL women for the development of the cluster in food processing. During the year 2009-2012, products based on the local resources were identified and standardised, trainings were designed, imparted to women from all the blocks of Wardha district. Products were branded and packaged as Wardhini. Six hundred SHG women members of 50 SHGs started their home based production. RANGRESHA Fabric product cluster- Nagpur district supported by NABARD AROHA has developed unique cluster of fabric based handicraft products. 300 women have participated in this cluster and have raised to the level of artisans from the zero skill level in the trades of hand-embroidery, stitching, ariwork and hand printing. Skills Training AROHAs Vocational Training initiative started in year 2004 with Rural entrepreneurship development programmes in various trades based on the natural resources, covering the 400 beneficiaries from rural areas of Vidarbha. 70 pc of them have started working. Uddyam vocational training centre was started in the year 2011 to train the rural underprivileged women in this area. Most of the participants are out of school due to the early marriage and have no hard skills to make a living out of it. After completion of training, some of them are employed by the garment factories and some are working independently. With their supplementary incomes, they are able to improve the standard of living of their families to the great extent. Till date 2250 women are trained in these centers. Around 63 percent of women are earning members of the family now. Hirwai - is the environment awareness programme of AROHA. Since year 2009, competition for tree plantation and protection is conducted for school children in association with Raman Science centre. Till date around 24,000 students have been educated through this activity. Hirwai - is the environment awareness programme of AROHA. detailsOfAchievement: According to National Study on Child Abuse conducted in 2007, as many as 53% children in India face sexual abuse at home, at school, at their places of work, and in institutional care. 50% abusers are persons known to the child or in a position of trust and responsibility. We are an award winning organization based in Mumbai working hard to address this issue of child sexual abuse. We are the largest NGO in India working to reduce the occurrence of child sexual abuse and heal its psychological, social, sexual and physical consequences. We are a 60 member team whose mission is to educate children by teaching them personal safety skills in order to empower them to deal with and tackle any form of sexual abuse. We recently achieved â€œPlatinum Certificationâ€ by â€˜Guide Star Indiaâ€™ for Transparency and Public accountability. Over the last 8 years Arpan has directed reached out to 135000 children, parents and teachers with Knowledge and skills to prevent the risk of child sexual abuse and 525000 indirectly through its all programs. 3 main programs 1. Personal Safety Education 2. Mental health services 3. Child sexual abuse awareness and training of trainers

title: Awishkar
detailsOfAchievement: Awishkar founded in 1971, is a group of serious theatre minded people formed to give free expression to the ideas and thoughts which are sacred to us in theatre. Awishkar a theatre institution known for its sincere and dedicated approach towards production of many plays has always functioned with various other purposes. Awishkar has time and proved that stage plays have always been an instrument in reaching different destinations, which has in mind right from its birth. It has always been a platform for performers from all faculties of art (adults and children alike) where their talents can be unraveled and further channeled in a proper direction. Awishkar takes great pleasure while mentioning about the 168 odd plays which it has produced and staged more than 4100 preformances. This creative treasure includes 30 children plays and dance dramas including 3 puppet plays. Awishkar has organized 23 theatre festivals, which offered more than 195 preformances to the theatre lovers. This includes a theatre festival of Tendulkarâ€™s 15 young directors. In addition, more than 50 experimental theatre Groups have staged more than 2000 performances at the Chhabildas Experimental Theatre, with the active co-operation of Awishkar from 1974 to 1992. Awishkar is known as the mother theatre institution and remained in forfront in leading the parallel theatre movement. Awishkarâ€™s contribution to Chhabildas theatre movement is very well known. After leaving Chhabildas in 1992, Awishkar explored three more spaces in Mumbai suburbs. At present Awishkar continues its theatre mission in a small hall of New Mahim Municipal school with the kind of co- operation of Mumbai Municipal Corporation. Awishkar Sanskritik Kendra organizes 6 performances of its plays in this small hall every month. These performances including plays by other theatre group also. For the last three year, Documentaries and short films by young and talented directors also are regularly screened in the hall. Creativity if rightly pampered and moulded can reach its epitome. This particular perception pre- empted Awishkar to organize more than 62 training Workshop for young and talented artists. Further, to divulge the different aspect of Musical plays, puppet shows and group singing it organize 66 Workshops for children with active participation of all the concerned technical experts. In addition Awishkar has conducted eight group discussions on different topics of the theatrical revelation.
